formal_accuser.name: Jennon femme Bertremin de Laval dit la Mouratte

confession.seduction_context: Very upset during hay harvest when one of his horses, maddened by flies, was killed jumping a fence. Devil promised plenty of money to buy other horses so he should never want.

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme Symon de Besmont
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, husband had dispute with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over water from village sewer, to which both laid claim

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same day ox fell ill, died two days later

witnesses.name: Jacquot Claudon Noel
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, formerly lodged in accused's house

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife or children fed three cows on grass Jean had cut
by accident he had carted a load instead of accused
testimony.threat_quote: he would repent, and would scarcely cart any more

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over ploughing at boundary of field; later dispute over ploughing in common when both wanted to go to market at Raon on same Saturday morning

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within a few days became ill, was in bed for 2 weeks
lost foal same day as market dispute

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused refused to compensate him for damage done by his animals

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within a fortnight sickened and died next day

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused did not feed village herdsman as witness and other inhabitants had done by turns
testimony.threat_quote: et que peult estre Dieu ne luy feroit la grace d'avoir des bestiaulx pour les chasser devant ledit paistre

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after accused visited and asked about their cows, sickened and died in 24 hours

testimony.threat_quote: que tant plus le deposant penseroit amasser que de tant plus s'en yroit il a neant

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after the threat, reduced to great poverty

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused was angry because witness had good horses and could cart half as much again in a load
accused sought joint ploughing arrangement, witness would only agree for limited period

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme Jean Berquey
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: asked to go crayfishing when she was young

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused wanted to rent a field near Boullain but husband preferred to let neighbor Jean Regnauldin have it

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: when grain grew, two thirds were lost to caterpillars

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused wanted to buy field from brother-in-law Claudon Malley of Le Mesnil for 40 ecus, husband planned to use 'retraite' if necessary

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: about 3 weeks after signing contract, became ill and was bedridden for 5 weeks in great danger

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute with husband over keeping of sheep

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after accused visited house asking about their cows

testimony.quarrel_subject: cows fed on grass from behind his house

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Denied all charges, made no circumstantial admissions

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses, no reproaches, no admissions

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews and racked, but would confess nothing. Said he wished he was a witch so he could confess and be released from torment.

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Procureur suggests he be renvoyé unless reason to take further evidence. Approved same day by Change de Nancy.

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Claudon Jean Perrin of Brehimont repeats confessions accusing Jean Marechal. Also confronted with Jean Seigaire. Jean started to confess after these confrontations.

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Confirmed confessions in two separate sessions

timeline.subject: Jean Marechal
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

accomplices_named.name: Jennon veuve Colas Ydoulx
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; also one of his accusers

accomplices_named.name: Didier Choppat
accomplices_named.context: Initially named at sabbat but later discharged, said he was not sure he had seen him

accomplices_named.name: Claudon Jean Perrin
accomplices_named.context: Named at sabbat; was one who accused Jean Marechal which led to his confession

prior_accusations.accuser_name: Jennon femme Bertremin de Laval dit la Mouratte

prior_accusations.context: Repeated confessions on 5 May 1611 including accusation against Jean Marechal
Had accused him since his torture

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Marechal
notable_quotes.french: que sy notre seigneur estoit encore sur terre, l'on pourroit trouver des personnes qui deposeroient telles choses contre de luy aussy bien que Judas
notable_quotes.english: if our lord were still on earth, one could find people who would depose such things against him as well as Judas
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation on 14 April 1611, denying charges

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon veuve Colas Ydoulx
notable_quotes.context: Confrontation with Jean Marechal on 14 April 1611

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Noel
notable_quotes.french: que sa sorciere de mere avoit commencé le ruyner et qu'il le voulloit achever
notable_quotes.english: that his witch of a mother had begun to ruin him and now he wanted to finish the job
notable_quotes.context: Said to accused when officer came to collect debt

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Regnauldin (to Jean Marechal)
notable_quotes.french: un pauvre homme d'endurer telles injures, et en debvoit poursuyvre la reparation, a quoy il ne feit autres responses sinon dire tout froidement qu'il n'y scauroit que faire, et laisseroit ledit Jean Noel pour le diable
notable_quotes.english: a poor man to endure such injuries, and should pursue reparation, to which he made no other response except to say quite coldly that he would know nothing to do about it, and would leave said Jean Noel to the devil
notable_quotes.context: After Jean Noel called accused a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Anthoine Doridant (threat from accused)
notable_quotes.french: et que peult estre Dieu ne luy feroit la grace d'avoir des bestiaulx pour les chasser devant ledit paistre
notable_quotes.english: and that perhaps God would not grant him the grace to have animals to drive before the said herdsman
notable_quotes.context: Threat made during dispute over feeding village herdsman

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Noel (threat from accused to his wife)
notable_quotes.french: que tant plus le deposant penseroit amasser que de tant plus s'en yroit il a neant
notable_quotes.english: that the more the deponent thought to accumulate, the more he would come to nothing
notable_quotes.context: Threat made after debt collection dispute

relationships.evidence_text: Father had been Colas Bidat alias le Mareschal of la Bourgonce, who had died when he was only 12 weeks old
his mother Claudatte alias la Gabouratte, who had died in prison after confessing she was a witch some 20 years earlier
had heard son-in-law Symon de Besmont blame him
her brother-in-law Claudon Malley of Le Mesnil
when living in house of accused at Nompatelize

harms_catalog.harm_description: ox fell ill same day, died two days later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over water from village sewer

harms_catalog.harm_description: cows lost their milk, slowly recovered
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife or children fed cows on grass Jean had cut
by accident witness had carted a load instead of accused

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, was in bed for 2 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over ploughing at boundary of field
dispute over ploughing in common, both wanted to go to market at Raon on same Saturday
accused refused to compensate for damage done by his animals, witness called him witch

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: witness's cow, only one giving milk
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: next day after accused visited and asked wife about their cows

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: debt collection, witness called accused witch saying his mother had begun to ruin him

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost 3 horses in a week, had to give up carting contract
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused was angry because witness had good horses and could cart half as much again
accused sought joint ploughing arrangement, witness refused except for limited period, accused was furious

harms_catalog.harm_description: two thirds lost to caterpillars, had to plant afresh
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused wanted to rent field near Boullain but husband preferred to let neighbor have it, accused was very angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, was bedridden for 5 weeks in great danger
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: accused wanted to buy field, husband planned to use 'retraite' if necessary
dispute with husband over keeping of sheep
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after accused visited and asked about their cows

harms_catalog.harm_description: died next day after accused tried black powder on it

harms_catalog.victim_name: ox belonging to Symon de Besmont

harms_catalog.harm_description: hail which did much damage at last la Magdelaine

material_culture.context: husband installed wooden dam to direct water from village sewer on his land
contracted to cart planks at Valdechamps and put them in river at La Voivre for merchants of Raon
accused bought servant Mathiatte a red bonnet as recompense for frightening her while crayfishing
wife of accused brought Jean de Besmont boiled fish to help him recover from illness
devil gave accused black powder for causing harm
devil gave him money which turned into leaves
danced to sound of flute at sabbat

spatial_references.context: Primary location where most witnesses and accused lived
Location of hermitage where accused lived for 18 years
River where planks were put for merchants of Raon
Market town where merchants were based, where people went to sell goods
Accused claimed voices witness heard came from quarrel at St Remy
River where planks were carted to
Location of sabbat attended by accused
Seigneurie where hail damage occurred; jurisdiction of court
Where Claudon Jean Perrin and Dieudonné Jean Thierion lived
Where Catherine veuve Colas Gelyat lived

weather_events: Thunder and lightning during night fishing incident
Hail damage in seigneurie of Etival at la Magdelaine (allegedly made at sabbat)
animal_predation: Large black animal seen jumping into water (accused claimed it was wolf)
economic_hardship_indicators: Jean Noel reduced to great poverty after losing 4 fine cows and other animals
Accused had 7 children who needed to be fed and brought up
Multiple disputes over economic resources: water rights, ploughing arrangements, carting contracts, field rentals

legal_context.redress_outcome: Multiple witnesses noted that when accused was called witch publicly, he did not seek legal reparation, responding coldly or saying he would leave the matter alone

hearsay_chains.source: Catherine veuve Colas Gelyat of l'Hoste du Bois, who heard from Mathiatte (servant to accused)
hearsay_chains.content: accused had taken Mathiatte out fishing at night for crayfish, something mysterious jumped between his legs in stream, he bought her red bonnet as recompense
boy had gone to fish for crayfish with accused and seen large black animal jump into water, accused told him it was wolf
threats accused had made against her husband when carting

emotional_state_notes: During initial interrogation made no circumstantial admissions
Compared himself to Jesus being falsely accused like Judas
During torture said he wished he was a witch so he could confess and be released from torment, but was a good Christian
Resisted torture because of concern for his 7 children
When finally confessing, recommended wife and children to care of Monsieur d'Etival and all those of the seigneurie

third_parties.name: Didier Claudon Noel
third_parties.context: Blamed accused for loss of a cow (mentioned by witness 1)

third_parties.name: Catherine veuve Colas Gelyat
third_parties.context: From l'Hoste du Bois, told story about Mathiatte's fishing expedition with accused

third_parties.name: Mathiatte
third_parties.context: Servant to accused who went crayfishing with him at night, saw something mysterious, given red bonnet

third_parties.name: Colas Mourizat
third_parties.context: Young boy who told story 16 years earlier about fishing with accused and seeing large black animal

third_parties.name: merchants of Raon
third_parties.context: Employed accused and others to cart planks

third_parties.name: Claudon Malley
third_parties.context: Of Le Mesnil, planned to sell field near Boullain

third_parties.name: Jennon veuve Colas Ydoulx
third_parties.context: Already executed witch who had accused Jean Marechal, also saw at sabbat

third_parties.name: Jean Seigaire
third_parties.context: Saw at sabbat, confronted with him which led to confession

third_parties.name: Claudon Jean Perrin
third_parties.context: Of Brehimont, repeated confessions including accusation against Jean Marechal on 5 May 1611

third_parties.name: wife of Mengeon Jean Dieudonné
third_parties.context: Of la Bourgonce, named at sabbat

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial of Jean Marechal, hermit of Boullain. Notable for his resistance to torture and delayed confession only after being confronted by other accused witches. His mother was also executed as a witch ~20 years earlier. Trial shows extensive pattern of economic disputes (water rights, carting contracts, ploughing arrangements, field rentals) followed by animal deaths. Accused initially denied everything, resisted torture claiming to be good Christian, but eventually confessed after other witches named him. Expressed concern for his 7 children throughout.
